poem:
Title: "Ascend Cangshan, Seek Peace"

Autumn leafed in Dali, aught by Silver Bridge, 
Observed the ridge-line's stoic, thousand-year blink.
It towered, Cangshan, over valley and village, 
A daily beckon - a siren inked in sky-edge.

Echoing east, whispers of 'Dalifornia',
Nine months in its thrall, a foreign explorer.
I cast my eyes heavenward, heart bound to follow,
Scaling that sentinel, peace in its shadow.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "My path to inner peace, via ‘Dalifornia’ in southwest China Nine months after I moved to Dali, in the autumn of 2020, I finally set off to climb Cangshan, the high mountain which towers over this valley in southwest China. Each morning, I had looked up at the top of its imposing ridge line, 2,000m above the village of Silver Bridge, north of Dali’s historic old town, that for a while I called home. Eighteen". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
